page.title: 16PHEASANT SHOOTS,HORNBY
page.content: Pheasants in Hornby wood are reared especially for the shooting season.The season is from October 1st to February 1st.During the close seasons pheasants are protected so that the young can grow.The young are reared in pens and fed on small grain.At a pheasant shoot there are usually 8 guns (shooters) with 2 guns and a loader each.There are 20 beaters who beat the ground to make the pheasants fly up.The 6 gun dogs retrieve the shot birds.A well organised shoot can cost up to Â£1000. Sometimes food is provided and it is eaten at a shooting lodge.
